B'zT, LLC is a fashion-technology company that provides BâZTÂ®, a smart t-shirt that has a washable chipset pre-embedded in the clothing. When a child in BâZT wanders off, BâzT system issues alarms to prevent any missing child.  After a lost-and-found experience that founder Kiyeon Nam had with her 3-year-old daughter at a shopping center, She was shocked to find that most tracking devices are expensive with monthly subscription plan and uncomfortable. As a mother of two children and a 20-year fashion industry veteran in New York City, she decided to develop a tracking device that is affordable, machine washable, has no battery recharging required, allows group tracking, and works anywhere in the world. In other words, she wanted the most comfortable tracking device in the world. After filing a first patent in 2015, Kiyeon and her team worked hard to bring B'zT to the market where it has already received recognition as one of the top tracking solutions for children.   Most of the tracking devices in the market are expensive with monthly subscription fees, and battery recharging is required. They are easy to loose and uncomfortable to wear especially for young children. In contrast, B'zT's washable tracking device is pre-embedded in a t-shirt. You can machine wash it, you don't need to recharge the battery. There is no subscription fee. B'zT's application of technology is non-intrusive and so simple that you don't even think it's a tracking device. You can treat B'zT just as a regular t-shirt and enjoy all the benefits of the technology.   One of the drawbacks of conventional tracking devices is the fact that they are easy to loose. Between charging and paying monthly fees for maintenance, parents and caregivers gets frustrated when the battery runs out or forgot to charge when you need to use. What if a parent has 5 children to monitor or a teacher has 30 students to track on a field trip? what if a whole entire school wants to monitor children every day in a least intrusive way? What if parent wash tracking device as if it's a regular clothing? Now with B'zT, for the first time in fashion-technology history, we can do this all for our children's safety.   Despite just coming into the market in 2017, B'zT has already received recognition from PC Magazine and others as one of the top tracker solutions for children. B'zT was honored to receive a Female Founder Recognition Award from Greylock Partners and TechCrunch, finalist for 2019 Edison Award. Through numerous presentations to school PTA, B'zT has been gaining recognitions by parents and teachers. Several schools in Korea has adopted B'zT school system and QM International Art Center, a private school in Flushing, New York adopted the system this year. B'zT's website and Amazon store are showing steady increase in sales.   B'zT is an integration of 100% Cotton t-shirt and 100% biodegradable eco friendly chipset molding. BâzTÂ® Chipset is designed with battery activation button which allows battery power to last up to a year. BâzT's innovative molding material allows BâzTâs intricate electronic circuits to be protected from multiple washes so that from the perspective of parents and children, B'zT feels just like any another t-shirt.   B'zT's technology also provides Field Trip Scanner with which a teacher can monitor up to 30 students during a field trip and School Bus GPS System where parents get not only the location information of the school bus, but also know if their children are all in the bus. With B'zT SCHOOL System, we can protect entire school so that students can learn in a most comfortable environment.   We believe when technology in the backdrop is non-intrusive, we can emphasize the positive means of human connection and provide children the sense of safety, security and confidence.

Claudia Giselle Design LLC is an award-winning full-service interior design studio.  We specialize in the design and development of residential, hospitality and commercial projects.  Our interiors are designed to elevate our clients' objectives with an emphasis on optimal functionality, meticulous attention to detail and aesthetic sophistication. Â Working intimately with our clients to customize a vision for their project and acting as their representative until its completion, we coordinate all phases of development to faithfully fulfill the design intent,Â time-frame and budget requirements.Â  Through close collaboration with our network of industry relationships, our mission is not only to meet, but to exceed, expectations.Â    Our services include: Interior Design â Interior design involves an array of disciplines from the technical to the artistic, from architectural drawings to color and textile selections.Â  At Claudia Giselle Design LLC, we are multidisciplinary and equally versed in the art and the science of interior design.Â  A design package from us may include: space-planning and drawings (floor-plans, elevations and details); hand sketches and computer renderings; FF&E and accessory specifications; plumbing fixture specifications; custom furniture and millwork design drawings; window treatment solutions; lighting selections and custom lighting design.  Project Coordination â No matter the size of the production, every orchestra needs a conductor; and experience has taught us that project leadership must be hierarchical to be effective, for the project to be well-organized and well-done.Â  Because we have a vested interest in seeing a project succeed beautifully and our clients happy, we are fully engaged in the construction process as project coordinators.Â  Acting on our clients' behalf, we facilitate bidding and negotiations (non-legal), hire and schedule the trades, convene with architects, engineers, code consultants, purchasing agents, developers, real estate brokers, facility managers, etc., and oversee construction and its thousands of details, so that the design intent is executed faithfully, the time-frame is respected and the budget is honored.  Purchasing âÂ  At Claudia Giselle Design LLC, we purchase the products and services required for the successful execution of a new construction or renovation project.Â  This process entails correspondence with vendors, generating requests for quotes, the handling of estimates, getting client approvals, generating purchase orders and managing payments, approving items prior to shipment, scheduling and tracking shipments, arranging receipt of products and materials, and quality assurance upon delivery.  Accessories & Art Sourcing â We will accessorize your entire project with all the items that create a completed space, including artwork selection and valuation, as well as navigating primary and secondary art markets on your behalf.Â   Furniture & Cabinetry Design â Sometimes the particularities of a space require a custom solution.Â  The perfect piece of furniture or built-in cabinet can indeed complete a space.Â  We design and work with talented artisans, fabricators and cabinet makers that use high-quality materials to build the design as specified.  Consulting â Frequently called upon by our peers for assistance, we lend our expertise to developers, architects, and designers.Â   Feasibility Studies â We provide our clients with a thorough analysis of a property. This includes research, concept design, site analysis and selection, needs and program development, cost analysis, and business and operational planning.

Childbirth Now Services  A leading provider of birth classes and Doula support, offering a practical approach to childbirth preparation. Each class is customized to lend insight and support to the unique goals of each family, based on maternal risk,preferences, birth location and expecting needs. Childbirth Classes: These courses are designed to help families understand the âplay by playâ once labor begins, inclusive of what to expect once entering the birth setting. Childbirth now founder Kayann Stephens uses her experience as a clinical nurse manager to discuss the âmechanicsâ of different birth locations to help families better manage all aspects of birth.  We keeps up to date with complementary best practices and hospital/birth center initiatives to ensure that her patients receive thorough and adequate insight to their birth experience. Expecting families will be educated and informed on the following:  Development of the third trimester Signs and symptoms of pre-term labor What to expect while in the hospital All stages of labor Distinction between true vs. false labor Relaxation and breathing Techniques Pain management options and medications When medical interventions & procedures are required Pushing positions Benefits of uninterrupted skin-to-skin with the newborn Postpartum needs and essentials Baby care for the first 2 weeks of life Optional breastfeeding support.  Infant CPR: Emergency preparedness class for non-healthcare professionals, nannies and new parents. Useful in infant breathing and choking scenarios. This class will help build the confidence you need to help your little addition to the family. Guidelines for instruction are based on standards set forth by The American Heart Association (AHA) and Academy of Pediatrics Guidelines on infant CPR. Course details include: Cardiopulmonary resuscitation (CPR) Choking Hands on training Classroom materials and literature Ages 10 and up are welcomed   Doula Support: Although not necessary, parents usually prefer to have the assistance of a Doula during labor to help manage the birth through coaching and hands-on techniques. Studies show that having the extra care of a Doula serves to shorten the labor, alleviate pain through use of pressure techniques and also reduce the risk of cesarean births.  Doula services include the following care: â¢Childbirth education class â¢Accompanied prenatal visits (optional) â¢Assistance with the preparation of a Birth Plan â¢Maternal Clinical Nursing support â¢Continuous Labor and Delivery Support â¢Support of uninterrupted skin to skin â¢Initial Breastfeeding Assistance (optional) Lactation support â¢Immediate postpartum support â¢Initial Postpartum visit at home Extended and continuous nursing support, including breastfeeding assistance, maternal guidance, etc.  The days following the birth of a child can bring some of the best moments a family will share. These times also call for an adjustment of daily routine and sleep patterns to accommodate the needs of a newborn. Postpartum care serves to alleviate some of the challenges during this transition period so that families can manage and fully enjoy their new family.  Postpartum Nursing: Postpartum mothers receive experienced maternity nursing care, coaching and assistance with:  Self care help for physical healing after birth Collaboration with midwife or obstetrician to assist with healing from all methods of delivery Recovery from c-section from a clinical nurse Lactation support Newborn care Infant sleeping habits Light housework Light healthy meals

Malik Law Firm is a Boutique Immigration and Criminal Defense Law Firm. Our areas of expertise are Immigration, Criminal Defense law and a specialized area of Crimmigration, which is the merging of Criminal and Immigration law. It is the practice of criminalizing the activities of certain immigrant groups. We help those who have fell victims of such.   We represent parties in Uncontested Divorce matters, conduct Know Your Rights Clinics and Trainings, providing resources and informing Immigrants and the Community about what their rights when they come in contact with Immigration officials, such as ICE or USCIS or local law enforcement, or New York State police or NYPD.   Immigration and Nationality Law: Business Immigration, Individual and Family Petitions, Motions and Appeals, Removal Defense. Criminal Defense: DUIs/DWIs, Traffic violations, Summons, Drug-related Offenses, Theft and Property Offenses, Juvenile Offenses, Bench and Arrest Warrants, Violent Offenses, Domestic Violence, Assault and Threat Offenses, Criminal Possession of Weapons, Criminal Contempt, Criminal Process, White Collar Crimes, Fraud, Sex Crimes, Other Felonies and Misdemeanors. Subcategories of Immigration Law: Immigrant Visas, Family Based Petitions, Adjustment of Status, Green Cards, Deportation Defense, Naturalization/Citizenship, Consular Processing, Asylum , Unlawful Presence Waivers, Supreme Court Challenges, Deferred Action of Childhood arrivals, Deferred Action of Parent Americans , Citizenship cases, U - Victim visas, T - Human Trafficking visas, VAWA - Violence Against Womens Act , Removal of Conditions, SIJ - Special Immigrant Juveniles, Board of Immigration Appeals cases, Diversity Lottery Visas. Non-Immigrant Visas - Temporary Stay in the United States: B-1/B-2 Visitor Visas, E-1 and E-2 visas - Individuals from countries with which the United States maintains commercial treaty relationships may qualify for admission for the purpose of trade or investment under an E-1 or E-2 visa; F visas - Academic and vocational students admitted to qualifying U.S. institutions may qualify for admission under a F visa; L-1A and L-1B visas - Employees of multinational companies transferred to facilities in the United States as part of their employment may qualify for admission under a L-1A or L-1B visa; K-1 - Fiance visa; PERM; O and P visas Â¿ Athletes, performers, artists, entertainers and those of extraordinary ability may qualify for temporary authorization to enter and work in the United States.  Over the years, we have successfully conducted immigration and criminal trials, including appeals in the Second and Ninth circuit courts and with the Board of Immigration Appeals. We have appeared before Executive Office of Immigration Review (EOIR) Immigration Judges and United States Citizenship and Immigration Services (USCIS).

Shaokao, Inc. was originally part of the conglomerate of BoConcept New York launched in 2003, which includes seven companies:  6 BoConcept furniture stores (each was set up as a separate individual company), plus its management company, all was owned and managed by Mr. Shaohao Cheng and wife Niki Cheng.   Mr. Shaokao Cheng was the largest BoConcept Chain owner with approximately 50 employees in New York area.  BoConcept New York received the 2009 NYC Small Business of the Year Award from New York City Mayor Bloomberg.  Mr. Shaokao Cheng received the 2010 Outstanding Asian American in Business Awards.  Mr. Shaokao Cheng, announced the March 1st, 2017 opening of the first Calligaris Brand Store at Soho, the epicenter for Art, Design and Fashion of New York City, after the husband and wife team have owned and operated the BoConcept Franchise in New York and New Jersey for 14 years.  The couple announced  the second Calligaris brand store in New York City on August 1st, 2017, located at 220 East 57th Street in the Upper East Side of Manhattan.   On September 1, 2017, Niki and Shaokao Cheng converted BoConcept store in the Chelsea neighborhood of Manhattan into stand-alone units for the high-end Calligaris and Camerich brands,  which was the coupleâs third Calligaris store and first Camerich store in New York.  The new 4,000 square-foot Calligaris store offers time tested designs from its 90-year history to the newest, innovative, functional, and customizable designs, while the adjoining 2,500 square-foot Camerich showroom will introduce New Yorkers to the innovative design aesthetic of the globally renowned company. The influence of Shaokao and Niki Cheng reverberates throughout New York City, emanating from their Camerich and Calligaris stores as well as the homes of countless clients. Since opening the very first Madison Avenue BoConcept location in 2003, the award-winning husband-and-wife entrepreneurs have become lifestyle magnates among Manhattanâs elite. During 2007, they started to expand and evolve their stores into cultural beacons, hosting immersive charity events benefiting The Lance Armstrong Foundation, intimate concert experiences with Tyrese and Kelly Price, fashion shows for designer Asher Levine and others, and launch parties for the likes of L.A. Reid, Darryl âD.M.C.â McDaniels, and many more. In under a decade, their clientele grew to include everyone from Susan Sarandon, Brooke Shields, and Liev Schreiber to Jay-Z, P Diddy, Mary J. Blige, Kid Cudi, and Tyson Beckford, to name a few. In addition to features in The New York Times, New York Post, and The Observer, their design work has been seen on The Apprentice, Design Star, Million Dollar listing, and in numerous commercials and movies, while Niki guested on NBCâs Today Show and Open House NYC as an expert.
